title: The Circle: Paddy leaves everyone in tears as he reveals his disability
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Emotional scenes are ahead on The Circle as Paddy reveals his disability to the other players.

Paddy holds a Circle ‘coming out party’ in scenes to air tonight as he shares his experiences in the group chat.

The players are given a reward after playing a game in the episode, which is that they can upload a new profile picture and get a bottle of bubbly.

Brooke chooses to add a family picture, Tim shows one with his partner and Georgina is on a night out with her brothers

Posting a picture of his crutches for the other contestants to see, Paddy, who has cerebral palsy, declares himself ‘disabled, queer and proud’.

He adds: ‘I feel like a f**king weight has been lifted.’

The players realise he is disabled and Georgina says how ‘proud’ she is of him.

Paddy reveals his disability to the other players (Picture: Channel 4)

Speaking in the group chat, Paddy explains that people tend to see his disability first, and he wanted to see what happened when people saw Paddy the person first.

Paddy says that he is ‘not ashamed’ of his disability, and so struggled to hide that part of him from the rest of the group.

His moving words bring players James and Ella to tears.

As the others send him encouraging messages, Woody jokes: ‘Unfortunately, we still like you.’

James, who is posing as a single mum called Sammie, feels a pang of guilt about catfishing the others as fellow players open up about their more difficult realities.

There’s also another catfish in the group, 62-year-old ‘Joyce’ aka eliminated players Beth and Jack.

Completely unknown to the rest of the contestants, the pair are pretending to be ‘Joyce’ on a joint profile.

Monday night’s episode saw them have a couple of near misses as Woody, Ella and Tim tried to suss them out. Can they keep it up?
